title: How is President’s Rule imposed? | Explained
content: What does Article 356 of the Constitution stipulate? How have different Governors dealt with dissolving Legislative Assemblies after President’s Rule has been invoked? When did the Supreme Court first intervene in the decision of the Union Government to impose President’s Rule?

title: Expect India-U.S. trade deal in not too distant future: U.S. Commerce Secretary
content: Howard Lutnick said in his keynote address at the eighth edition of the U.S.-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) in Washington on Sunday

title: News Analysis: Ahead of polls, all eyes in Bihar on Chirag Paswan’s next political move
content: The LJP(RV) chief and party MP has said he does not see himself in national politics for long; the statements from him and his party have generated considerable interest, amid buzz that the could play a bigger role in State politics in the future

title: Ennore: Where industrial growth has made life difficult for residents
content: Residents of Ennore struggle with pollution on a day-to-day basis, but it gains widespread attention only when a major incident occurs

title: Home Minister’s remarks on West Bengal CM opposing Operation Sindoor incorrect and motivated, says TMC
content: On June 1, the Home Minister Amit Shah had accused the Trinamool Congress chairperson of opposing “Operation Sindoor” to “appease the Muslim vote bank”. In a statement the TMC said that “the CM has consistently backed national security initiatives, including Operation Sindoor”

title: Telangana govt. to develop 80-acres Eco-Town modelled on Japanese city Kitakyushu
content: The State government of Telangana will also be collaborating with Kitakyushu on several forward-looking initiatives

title: Under pressure on the battlefield, Ukraine turns to drones to hurt Russia
content: Ukraine claimed its Sunday attacks destroyed over 40 Russian warplanes, including nuclear-capable bombers; Russia says the strikes were repelled with no casualties; the attack was in the works for 18 months, says Kyiv; the strike came as both sides were preparing for peace talks in Istanbul

title: Officers close to Jharkhand CM conspiring against me, alleges BJP leader Babulal Marandi
content: JMM hit back at Mr. Marandi, saying he has made a baseless allegation for petty politics; party spokesperson Tanuj Khatri says under the visionary leadership of Hemant Soren, Jharkhand has entered a new phase of inclusive development

title: BJP takes dig at Congress ahead of Rahul Gandhi’s visit to Haryana
content: The Congress in Haryana is yet to choose its Legislature Party leader (CLP), who would serve as the Leader of Opposition in the Assembly, though it has been eight months since the new govt. was formed in the State

title: New Uttar Pradesh DGP outlines blueprint to improve policing
content: The 1991-batch Indian Police Service (IPS) officer expressed gratitude to U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for trusting him to lead the world’s largest “provincial police force

title: India to get remaining S-400 missile systems by 2026, says Russia
content: Russia also hinted at expanding bilateral cooperation with India in air defence and anti-drone systems

title: SRMIST and The Hindu to organise webinar on emerging careers
content: It will explore the growing demand for inter-disciplinary professionals in areas such as digital strategy, behavioural economics, climate policy, and UX (user experience) design

title: Devdutta Majhi from West Bengal’s Katwa secures top rank among girls in JEE (Advanced)
content: She has secured a top rank in JEE (Mains) this year, while also featuring among the Statewide top ten merit lists in the class 10 and class 12 board examinations

title: Pahalgam attack casts shadow on turnoutat Kheer Bhawani
content: With a sense of fear looming large this year post-Pahalgam attack and the four-day military confrontation between India and Pakistan, local politicians have come forward to encourage Pandits to visit the Valley temples.

title: Punjab approves new land pooling policy; Akali Dal terms it anti-farmer
content: Complete authority lies with the farmer, and it will be their decision whether to give land to the government or not; farmers can either keep their land and continue farming or choose to sell; there will be no forced acquisition

title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar government over death of minor rape victim at govt. hospital
content: It is alleged that the critically injured nine-year-old remained in an ambulance for several hours for want of bed

title: Rahul Gandhi approaches Jharkhand High Court challenging a non-bailable warrant
content: The case is related to Mr. Gandhi’s speech against Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders in March 2018

title: For most residents of Pakistan Tola in Bihar, the village name is an embarrassment
content: Ever since the Pahalgam attacks in April this year, people of Pakistan Tola in Bihar’s Purnia district have been demanding to change the name of the village they have been living in for years

title: Adani says it doesn't handle Iranian cargo, unaware of any U.S. probe into Iran sanctions violations
content: It went on to state that the Adani group "does not manage or facilitate any ships whose owners are Iranian. This policy is strictly adhered to across all our ports".

title: Hoardings that pose a threat to public safety yet to be removed
content: Outdoor advertisers in Kozhikode city yet to act despite SHRC directive; residents warn of serious monsoon-season risks; Corporation promises strict follow-up action within a week

title: Praveshanolsavam marks school reopening in district
content: Minister G.R. Anil inaugurates the district-level Praveshanolsavam at Government Higher Secondary School, Kavalayoor, Attingal, on Monday

title: Dam protests: NHRC issues notice to Arunachal government
content: According to the reports, on May 23, 2025, a Human Rights activist and Convenor of the Siang Indigenous Farmers Forum led a protest against the dam construction in Beging village in which approximately 400 people participated.

title: Pakistan's Punjab speaker backs Pahalgam attacker at rally
content: A Pakistani Punjab assembly speaker, Malik Ahmed Khan, has sparked controversy by publicly supporting Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) deputy chief Saifullah Kasuri, a US-designated terrorist linked to the Pahalgam attack. Khan defended Kasuri at a rally, dismissing accusations pending investigation.

title: 'What if China stops Brahmaputra water?': Assam CM shuts down 'Pak's scare narrative'
content: Assam's Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma refuted Pakistan's claims about China potentially weaponizing the Brahmaputra River. Sarma clarified that the Brahmaputra is primarily fed by Indian monsoon rains, with China contributing only a smaller portion of its flow. He dismissed the concerns as fear-mongering, highlighting India's dominant role in sustaining the river's volume and asserting its water sovereignty.

title: Army duo, porter die as landslide hits Sikkim camp
content: A devastating landslide in Sikkim's Mangan district claimed the lives of two Army personnel and a porter after their camp was swept away due to heavy rainfall. Rescue operations are underway to locate six missing individuals, including an Army officer, his wife, and their daughter.

title: Indian flyers to double in 5 yrs, ambition to commercialise space flights: PM
content: PM Modi highlighted India's soaring aviation sector at IATA's AGM, projecting flyer footfall to double by 2030 and airport numbers to reach 350 by 2047. He emphasized India's ambition to become a $4 billion MRO hub and a leader in space-aviation convergence.

title: IPL Final, RCB vs PBKS: Mood in Ahmedabad completely dry ahead of title decider
content: Ahmedabad's mood ahead of the IPL 2025 final between RCB and PBKS is unexpectedly subdued, with low fan turnout and sluggish merchandise sales. Despite star power and high stakes, the city lacks buzz. Rain remains a threat but excitement lingers as fans await a new champion. Will it be Rajat Patidar’s RCB or Shreyas Iyer’s Punjab Kings?

title: 'Grandfather category': Usha Vance recalls how her kids bonded with PM Modi
content: Usha Vance, wife of US Vice President JD Vance, expressed admiration for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's hospitality following their family's visit to India in April. She highlighted the special meeting with PM Modi, noting her children's instant affection for him, further solidified by a thoughtful birthday gift.

title: 'Bas jeetna hai': Shreyas Iyer's mother's heartfelt wish ahead of IPL final
content: The IPL final is set as Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru, both seeking their first title, clash in Ahmedabad. PBKS, led by talismanic captain Shreyas Iyer, returns to the final after a decade. An emotional video message from Iyer's family, filled with Punjabi spirit, has boosted the team's morale.

title: US ‘vows’ visa bans on foreign officials threatening Apple, Google, Microsoft
content: The U.S. has introduced a visa policy targeting foreign officials who censor American citizens' social media posts, escalating tensions over digital free speech. This move supports U.S. tech companies facing pressure from international regulators regarding content moderation. However, the policy risks diplomatic backlash and potential retaliatory measures in key global markets.

title: 6.2 magnitude earthquake hits Greece, tremors felt in Turkey
content: A 6.2 magnitude earthquake struck the Dodecanese Islands in Greece near the Turkish border, as reported by EMSC. Simultaneously, a 5.8 magnitude earthquake hit Marmaris, Turkey, injuring seven as residents fled, according to Governor Idris Akbiyik. Centered in the Mediterranean Sea, the quake was felt in Rhodes, Greece. Turkey, prone to earthquakes, experienced a devastating 7.

title: Symptoms of Vitamin D deficiency in your hair and skin
content: Even for a tropical country like ours that gets plenty of sunshine, almost 80% of the population suffers from Vitamin D deficiency. Known as the "sunshine vitamin", Vitamin D is a nutrient the body needs, along with calcium, to build bones and keep them healthy. When your body lacks enough vitamin D, it can show up in subtle but important ways, especially in your hair and skin. Here are some signs that you need some Vitamin D

title: Behind Shreyas Iyer 2.0 and WhatsApp group named 'Team Shreyas'
content: PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer's 39 sixes so far this IPL is more than that of his combined sixes in the last three seasons. The 30-year-old saw brought about marked improvements in his strike rate and batting average. Here's how a technique tailor made for him proved to be the difference.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO's warning to US on China tariffs: They're not scared...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon cautioned American officials against underestimating China's resilience in the trade conflict, highlighting their preparedness and determination. He warned against expecting China to concede to American pressure, emphasizing their capacity to address challenges with significant resources. Dimon also expressed concerns about the United States' overall readiness for future global conflicts, particularly in military strength.

title: India clears literacy exam with 80.9%, but gender & urban-rural gaps remain
content: The PLFS 2023-24 reveals India's overall literacy rate at 80.9% for those aged seven and above, with Mizoram leading at 98.2%. Significant disparities persist across states, gender, and urban-rural divides. Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, and Rajasthan have the lowest literacy rates, while Rajasthan exhibits the widest gender gap, highlighting the need for focused interventions in education.

title: Stephen Curry surprises son Canon with MrBeast video call in sweet moment
content: Stephen Curry delighted his son Canon with a surprise video call from Mr. Beast, a moment that quickly went viral. As Curry enjoys his offseason, speculation arises about his potential retirement after the 2025-26 season. His expanding business ventures under Thirty Ink, including investments in golf and media, suggest a thriving post-NBA career.

title: The right time for women to drink coffee for longevity and healthy aging
content: Coffee offers health benefits. It is packed with antioxidants. It improves brain function. It lowers risks of diseases. Dr. Sara Mahdavi's study shows caffeinated coffee helps women age healthily. The study followed almost 50,000 women for 30 years. It will be presented at NUTRITION 2025 in Orlando. Morning coffee keeps women mentally strong and physically fit.

title: 'Trump and Xi likely to speak this week,' says White House official
content: White House confirms that President Trump and President Xi are likely to speak this week amidst escalating trade tensions. Treasury Secretary Bessent indicated the discussion would address disputes over critical minerals and export limitations. Despite extended tariff exclusions and previous negotiations, core U.S. concerns about China's economic structure remain unresolved, with ongoing legal battles over tariff implementation.

title: Kota boy Rajit Gupta beats Haryana student in tie-breaker to top JEE-A
content: Rajit Gupta from Kota topped the JEE Advanced 2025, scoring 332 out of 360. Saksham Jindal secured the same score but ranked second due to tie-breaking criteria. Kota celebrated with 42 students in the top 100. Devdutta Majhi from West Bengal emerged as the top-ranking female candidate. Cutoffs decreased significantly this year, with the IIT Hyderabad zone leading in qualifiers.

title: Man whose FIR led to influencer arrest also faces hate-post cases
content: Wazahat Khan Qadri, who filed a complaint leading to the arrest of a law student for allegedly hurting religious sentiments, is now facing multiple complaints himself for allegedly making communal and inflammatory posts on social media. Kolkata police are verifying these complaints and promise legal action.

title: PM Modi likely to flag off Vande Bharat train to Srinagar this week
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to inaugurate the Katra-Srinagar Vande Bharat train service this week, marking the first rail link to the Kashmir Valley. This launch, initially delayed due to weather and security concerns, symbolizes the Centre's commitment to the region's development following the Pahalgam attack.

title: Paraguay President joins PM Modi in condemning Pahalgam attack
content: PM Modi and Paraguay President Santiago Pena discussed strengthening bilateral cooperation in digital technology, critical minerals, and other sectors. Modi appreciated Paraguay's condemnation of the Pahalgam terror attack, emphasizing their united stance against terrorism. Both leaders recognized the potential for collaboration in combating cybercrime, organized crime, and drug trafficking, while also exploring ways to expand trade through MERCOSUR.

title: Tamil Nadu, Tripura, Delhi lead in adult literacy, shows test data so far
content: Tamil Nadu, Tripura, and Delhi have excelled in the 2024-25 Foundational Literacy and Numeracy Assessment Test (FLNAT), showcasing high success rates in adult literacy and education. While the national average certification rate stands at 19.4%, skewed by pending data, these states demonstrated exceptional performance.

title: Should the Eagles star worry about falling prey to Madden curse?
content: Saquon Barkley will be on the cover of Madden NFL 26. He is the first Eagles offensive player in the '99 Club'. Barkley had a record-breaking season. Now, the 'Madden Curse' looms. This curse is known for impacting cover athletes. Many players have faced injuries or poor performance. But recent trends show the curse might be fading.

title: 2nd consecration at Ram temple begins today
content: Ayodhya is set for a second consecration ceremony at the Ram temple, starting Tuesday, featuring deity installations in six temples and the Ram Darbar inauguration on June 5. Champat Rai urged devotees to avoid visiting during the 'pran pratishtha' due to weather and limited arrangements. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath will attend the June 5 events, coinciding with Ganga Dussehra.

title: Kylie Jenner packed only New York Knicks merchandise for game night
content: Kylie Jenner's enthusiasm for the New York Knicks was evident as she attended games with Timothée Chalamet, showcasing her team spirit through orange and blue attire. Her recent Instagram story revealed a suitcase filled with Knicks-themed clothing, including jerseys, caps, and even a glimpse of her lingerie collaboration with Fleur Du Mal in team colors.

title: 'Mission: Impossible' records the lowest box office collection on third Monday
content: ‘Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning’ has grossed approximately Rs 91.70 crore at the Indian box office after 17 days. Despite new releases, the Tom Cruise starrer crossed Rs 90 crore by its third weekend. While the opening week saw a collection of Rs 54.4 crore, Monday witnessed the lowest collection at Rs 1.25 crore.

title: Malaysia backs India on counter-terrorism
content: Following the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor, Malaysia has voiced strong support for India's counterterrorism efforts and regional peace initiatives. Deputy Minister Saraswathy Kandasamy emphasized Malaysia's zero-tolerance stance on violence, urging Pakistan to abandon terrorism for regional progress. Malaysia's shift towards aligning with India on stability and growth is evident as it prepares to chair ASEAN in 2025.

title: PM Modi to hold first meet of council of ministers after Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to chair a council of ministers meeting on Wednesday, marking the first such gathering after Operation Sindoor and preceding the completion of his first year in his third term.

title: 'Tesla not interested in manufacturing in India': HD Kumaraswamy
content: Tesla is prioritizing showrooms in India to sell its vehicles, according to Heavy Industry Minister H D Kumaraswamy. The EV giant is reportedly focused on importing cars and seeking concessions under the India-US trade agreement to offer cheaper vehicles. Despite government efforts to promote local manufacturing, Tesla has not expressed interest in producing cars in India.

title: IndiGo CEO backs government policy as Emirates seeks more seats
content: As Indian airlines aim to capture a larger share of international travel, IndiGo's CEO, Pieter Elbers, has strongly opposed Emirates' persistent requests for increased flying rights to Dubai. Elbers emphasized the need for mutual agreement in bilateral agreements, highlighting the importance of utilizing existing traffic rights before considering new ones, a stance contrasting with Emirates' call for more capacity.

title: IPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: Playing soon - a song of fire and ice in Ahmedabad
content: Rajat Patidar-led, and Virat Kohli-inspired, RCB face Shreyas Iyer’s calm and calculated Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 final. It’s fire versus ice, emotion versus composure, as both teams chase their maiden IPL title amid looming rain in Ahmedabad.

title: MP cop benched for instructing gym owner to bar Muslims
content: A Bhopal police officer, Sub-Inspector Dinesh Sharma, was removed from active duty after a video surfaced showing him instructing a gym owner to ban Muslim trainers and trainees. This followed a Bajrang Dal objection to Muslim trainers at the gym.

title: Amit Shah bats for bigger role for farm credit societies
content: Amit Shah emphasized the crucial role of Primary Agricultural Credit Societies (PACS) in the government's foodgrain storage plan, highlighting their importance for financial stability. He instructed the food ministry and FCI to map warehouses nationally to meet regional needs and integrate PACS with more storage facilities.

title: Hailee Steinfeld marries Josh Allen but fans pull Michael B Jordan into the drama
content: Buffalo Bills' quarterback Josh Allen and actress Hailee Steinfeld have officially tied the knot in a beautiful California wedding. Despite fan speculation linking Steinfeld to her 'Sinners' co-star Michael B. Jordan, the 'True Grit' actress looked radiant in her strapless white dress. Social media users playfully referenced Jordan in their reactions to the wedding photos.

title: 'Is it so difficult to be patriotic?': Khurshid amid Cong flak over Article 370 remarks
content: Salman Khurshid has criticized those within his own party who are undermining the government's efforts to raise global awareness about Pakistan's terrorism agenda. He questioned the difficulty of prioritizing patriotism over political allegiances, echoing Shashi Tharoor's sentiments. Khurshid's earlier support for the abrogation of Article 370, contrasting with Congress' stance, has fueled further controversy, drawing criticism from the BJP.

title: Rickea Jackson shuts down pregnancy rumors after missing the Los Angeles Sparks game
content: Los Angeles Sparks forward Rickea Jackson has addressed pregnancy rumors circulating online following her absence from a recent game. Jackson, listed as “out for personal reasons,” responded with humor, posting a photo on X holding a basketball to her stomach, captioned “#ItsAGirl”. She later clarified she is not pregnant, emphasizing her focus on being a 'rich auntie'.

title: Adivasis say Project Tiger and tourism are displacing them from their ancestral land
content: Indigenous communities in India are facing displacement from their ancestral lands due to tourism and tiger projects, despite laws meant to protect them. Adivasis at a global press briefing highlighted the dilution and improper implementation of these protective measures.

title: Trump asks Supreme Court to overrule lower court block on mass federal layoffs
content: The Trump administration has approached the US Supreme Court. It wants to implement widespread layoffs and agency closures. A lower court had halted these actions. The administration argues it doesn't need Congressional approval for staffing decisions. They call the lower court's ruling indefensible. Critics fear the changes will weaken essential public services.

title: Rohit Sharma bows to Arjun Tendulkar after Mumbai Indians' IPL exit - WATCH
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive innings of 87 propelled Punjab Kings to a thrilling five-wicket victory over Mumbai Indians in Qualifier 2, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Mumbai Indians' exit guarantees a first-time champion this season, with captain Hardik Pandya acknowledging Iyer's brilliance and MI's bowling shortcomings under pressure.

title: Nisha Aur Uske Cousins fame Vibhu Raghave passes away after fighting cancer
content: Vibhu Raghave, renowned for his role in 'Nisha Aur Uske Cousins,' has tragically passed away on June 2 after a three-year battle with stage 4 neuroendocrine colon cancer. Despite the cancer spreading to multiple organs, he bravely shared his journey and remained hopeful during chemotherapy. His resilience touched many, and his passing is a significant loss to the television industry.

title: Preity Zinta's epic 'Punjabi aa gaye oye' shoutout will give you goosebumps
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive 87 propelled Punjab Kings to the IPL 2025 final, defeating Mumbai Indians by five wickets in Qualifier 2. Chasing 204, PBKS was set up by Inglis's quickfire start and Iyer's dominant innings, featuring eight sixes. They will now face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the final, marking their first appearance since 2014.

title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, bomb threat triggers panic at Jammu Tawi railway station
content: A bomb threat caused panic at Jammu Tawi railway station ahead of Prime Minister Modi's visit on June 6 to inaugurate the train service to Kashmir. Railway Police conducted a thorough search of the station using sniffer dogs and metal detectors.

title: 'Hygiene not being maintained': Influencer Sharmishta files plea over jail conditions
content: Social media influencer Sharmishta Panoli's arrest for allegedly hurting religious sentiments has sparked controversy. Her advocate claims she's being denied basic rights and her health is deteriorating in custody. Despite deleting the video and apologizing, her arrest has drawn criticism from legal professionals and political figures, who deem it excessive and politically motivated, while police insist all procedures were followed.

title: 'Performed very efficiently': Russia says India to get remaining S-400 systems by 2026
content: Russia is set to complete the delivery of S-400 air defence systems to India by 2025-2026, as confirmed by Russian authorities. The deputy chief of the Russian mission in India highlighted the system's effectiveness and expressed openness to expanding cooperation in air defense and anti-drone technologies, building on the long-standing partnership between the two nations.

title: 'Made a mistake': Ajit Pawar's big admission on Ladki Bahin scheme
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Ajit Pawar admitted the government erred in disbursing Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana funds without proper vetting due to pre-election time constraints. Thousands of ineligible recipients, including government employees, benefited. While funds already disbursed won't be recovered, future payouts will undergo stricter scrutiny.

title: Celebrations mark reopening of schools in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: The Praveshanolsavam (school opening day celebration) unfolded as a grand cultural event, full of colour, music, and community spirit

title: IAP Kerala comes out with guidelines for students, parents and schools
content: The school authorities and parents should create awareness about substance abuse among students, says IAP functionaries

title: For students of Vellarmala school, a new chapter in life
content: They were welcomed by teachers, accompanied by a band; 25 high school and 11 higher secondary teachers honoured on the occasion

title: CHOs express concern over delay in receiving salaries
content: The CHOs have been on a strike for more than a month demanding payment of pending incentives, an increase in their pay of ₹25,000, regularisation of services of those who completed six years and resumption of PF

title: UDF to step up stir against alleged corruption in Kozhikode Corpn.
content: ‘The recent Vigilance raid on the office and home of the Superintending Engineer is an attempt to save the bigger fish by sacrificing a smaller one’

title: Maharashtra records 873 COVID-19 cases since January, 10 deaths reported
content: Public Health Department confirms surge in infections; genome sequencing and surveillance surveys underway

title: Dilip Ghosh’s absence at Modi, Shah events sparks speculation over internal rift in Bengal BJP
content: Ghosh says he was absent from events because he was not invited to them; talk of division in the ranks continues as the party is yet to pick a president for the State unit

title: Missing Indore man’s body recovered from gorge in Meghalaya; search for wife on
content: Police drone find the body of Raja Raghuvanshi after an eight-day search; couple went missing on May 24

title: Union Home Secretary visits Kuki-Zo relief camps in Manipur, attends security review meeting with Governor
content: The visit comes in the wake of fresh protests and a ‘civil disobedience” call by Meitei groups in the northeastern State

title: India, Paraguay can expand trade with MERCOSUR, says PM Modi
content: New opportunities to be explored in areas such as digital technology, critical minerals, energy, agriculture, healthcare, defence, railways, space, and overall economic partnership

title: U.K. Minister discussed border security with Indian officials in April
content: The U.K Home Office said that, in the past one year, there had been a 45% increase in Indian nationals detained by the immigration authorities, including people who were to be returned

title: Rare migratory bird sighted on Kappad beach five years ago identified as Caspian Gull
content: The Caspian Gull, usually found in Central Asia, visits northwestern India, such as Gujarat, in winter. It was sighted in Goa only once and never again in south India until this time, says Kozhikode-based ornithologist

title: Ponguleti says Revenue Department at the ‘People’s Doorstep’ from Tuesday
content: Revenue Sadassus in which revenue teams, led by Tahsildars, will travel to each revenue village, accepting applications and resolving issues on the site will resume from Tuesday to cover all villages

title: Five from two families killed, two injured in road accidentin East Godavari
content: The incident occurred when a car, in which the seven persons were returning from Kakinada beach, hit a milk tank from behind on Kakinada-Rajahmundry ADB road.

title: Rahul Gandhi to launch campaign to revamp Congress in Madhya Pradesh
content: Rahul will visit the State and hold separate meetings with political affairs committee, the party’s MPs and MLAs in the State, among others

title: Kolkata Police defend arrest of influencer over ‘hate speech’
content: BJP terms action against Sharmistha Panoli as political vendetta; police say arrest in line with legal provisions

title: Pakistan too sends delegations abroad to present its case
content: Teams to call for international “role” in the region, and plead Pakistan’s case for the restoration of Indus Waters Treaty, suspended by India after the Pahalgam terror attack

title: 153 acre green space to come up soon in North Bengaluru
content: An Indira Gandhi Biological Park, Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Bird Park, Kempegowda Zoo, Saalumarada Thimmakka Arboretum among others are being planned to be set up

title: U.K. is with India against terrorism: Indo-Pacific Minister tells all-party delegation
content: Group led by MP Ravi Shankar Prasad conveys India’s concerns regarding Pakistan, addresses Indian diaspora in London

title: Medigadda Barrage collapse: 17 officials to face criminal charges and 33 disciplinary action
content: Vigilance Commission finds fault with L&T Precision Engineering Systems (L&T-PES) for lapses on several fronts and recommends steps to follow in future

title: Centre calls for proposals to set up de-addiction centres in 291 ‘gap’ districts
content: The highest number of ‘gap’ districts have been identified in Chhattisgarh, where 31 of the State’s 33 districts have figured in the list

title: Protests at Idukki school over cancellation of English medium division
content: Parents say they were intimated of the move asked to shift students to Malayalam medium or other schools only on May 30. DDE asks teachers to ensure that future studies of students remain unaffected

title: Senior Rajasthan IAS officer Alok passes away
content: Additional Chief Secretary in Rajasthan’s Energy Department succumbed to cancer; remembered for expertise in energy sector

title: KAHWA accuses Kerala government of being vengeful towards ASHAs
content: KAHWA accuses government of slashing ASHAs’ honorarium of ₹7,000 by bringing in new caveats regarding incentives

title: It is a straight fight between LDF, UDF in Nilambur, says Congress
content: All India Congress Committee (AICC) general secretary (Organisation) K.C. Venugopal says Anvar and belated entrants into the electoral fray, including the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), were not a factor in the crucial bypoll

title: INDIA bloc to push for special session of parliament on Pahalgam attack
content: As per sources, the Opposition was undecided on whether to pen a joint letter or to get every Opposition MP to send a separate plea for a joint session.

title: Police to launch Campus Beats against drugs in Idukki schools
content: The project is a joint initiative of the school authorities, Parent Teachers’ Associations, parents, and the public, says District Police Chief at the district’s Praveshanolsavam

title: Integrated hostel with 1,000 intake inaugurated in Dharwad
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi says providing quality education and skill training should be a top priority

title: NCC, Shapoorji & Pallonji, and L&T to build five towers in Amaravati at ₹3,673 crore
content: CRDA approves their bids for GAD Tower, HoD Towers 1 and 2, and 3 and 4 at ₹882 crore, ₹1,488 crore and ₹1,303 crore respectively; Municipal Administration Minister P. Narayana says CRDA approved issue of Letters of Agreement to the firms with the mandate to begin the works immediately

title: NASSCOM delegation discusses Andhra Pradesh’s tech vision with Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh is a compelling alternative to saturated hubs, offering  a unique advantages for India’s growing tech sector, says Naidu

title: Two gruesome murders shock West Bengal; bodies recovered in separate incidents
content: In Malda, man’s body found buried in a wall; in South 24 Parganas, accused parades severed head of sister-in-law

title: Texas Tech ends OU's reign to reach WCWS finals
content: Oklahoma's run of four straight Women's College World Series titles ended when Lauren Allred's walk-off sacrifice fly gave Texas Tech a 3-2 victory in the semifinals Monday night.

title: Sources: Yankees closer Weaver out 4-6 weeks
content: New York Yankees closer Luke Weaver is expected to miss at least four weeks with a hamstring injury, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Monday.

title: Young rallies to clinch U.S. Open spot in playoff
content: Cameron Young birdied three of his last four holes Monday to get into a 5-for-1 playoff and then made a 12-foot birdie to earn his spot in the U.S. Open.

title: Homa lugs bag for 36 but misses U.S. Open field
content: Max Homa stood out more than usual Monday in a U.S. Open qualifier filled with PGA Tour players. He was the only one carrying his own bag.

title: Deion rips 'foolish' reports on Shedeur draft prep
content: Deion Sanders says he was "hurt" by reports that his son Shedeur Sanders was unprepared during predraft meetings with NFL teams, but he also isn't buying the validity of them, either.

title: Police: Overseas bettor behind McCullers threats
content: An intoxicated bettor located overseas was behind social media threats directed last month at Houston Astros pitcher Lance McCullers Jr. and his family, according to Houston police.

title: Pats' Andrews on retiring: 'Wanted to finish it here'
content: Longtime New England Patriots center David Andrews said Monday that he retired from the NFL after 10 seasons because he wanted to play for only one team.

title: Franco wants justice done as trial begins in D.R.
content: The trial of Tampa Bay Rays shortstop Wander Franco started Monday in the Dominican Republic in a sexual abuse case involving a 14-year-old girl.

title: 🔍 Examining if the 'Madden curse' is reality
content: The alleged curse on players who feature on the cover of the iconic NFL game is well known, but has it actually had merit over the past decade?

title: Three potential Cooper Flagg trades the Mavericks might not immediately reject

content: The Knicks' breakthrough postseason ended in the East finals, but there is plenty to build on in Gotham.

title: Sports betting isn't legal in all 50 states ... or is it?
content: A dispute between gambling regulators and an upstart company is testing what is a sports bet and what is not.

content: The Jaguars' first-year head coach has learned from Mark Whipple, Sean McVay and his dad. Now, he's building his own team.

content: PSG's victory in Saturday's UEFA Champions League means that their Qatari owners have finally summited club football. Where do they go from here?

content: United are at a fork in the road with their captain. Do they take the money from Al Hilal, or keep their talisman?

content: Nadal has left an indelible mark on the French Open -- but Swiatek, Alcaraz and others may be able to carry on the legacy.

content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

content: Andreas Hale shares his thoughts on what should be next for both fighters after sharing the same boxing card on Saturday.

title: Has Verstappen's Spanish GP tantrum cost him F1 title shot?
content: Max Verstappen is already on the back foot in the F1 title fight. His Spain outburst didn't help his cause.

title: Waiver wire: Add Royals' Caglianone for power potential
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines who should be claimed off the waiver wire, including potential slugger Jac Caglianone, and who should be dropped from fantasy rosters.

title: Atlético Madrid renew Griezmann contract to '27
content: Antoine Griezmann has signed a one-year contract extension at Atlético Madrid which would keep him at the club until June 30, 2027.

title: Sources: Klopp's former assistant to join Man City
content: Manchester City are closing in on a deal to name Pep Lijnders as part of Pep Guardiola's new-look backroom staff, sources have told ESPN.

title: Giráldez confirmed as new OL Lyonnes coach
content: Jonatan Giráldez has officially been announced as the new head coach of eight-time European women's champions OL Lyonnes.

title: Sources: City eye Aït-Nouri in summer rebuild
content: Manchester City are looking to sign Wolves full-back Rayan Ait-Nouri as part of their summer rebuild, sources have told ESPN.

title: Madrid's Huijsen wants to be like Sergio Ramos
content: Real Madrid's new signing Dean Huijsen has said he wants "to be like Sergio Ramos," praising the former Madrid captain as his "idol."

title: Prem players concerned over post-season tours
content: Players from Premier League teams have contacted the PFA, the players' union, to "express concern" over their involvement in post-season tours, PFA CEO Maheta Molango, has said.

title: Sources: Postecoglou to learn Spurs fate this week
content: Ange Postecoglou is set to learn his fate as Tottenham Hotspur manager this week, sources have told ESPN.

title: Seattle players demand fair MLS payout for CWC
content: Seattle Sounders FC players are demanding a fair share of the FIFA Club World Cup prize money the team secured when qualifying for the international tournament, and received backing from the Major League Soccer Players Association on Sunday.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi, Suárez help Miami surge up the list
content: With nine goals in two games, it's official: Inter Miami are back! Just how far have Messi & Co. jumped up ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter to offer Højlund an escape from Man United
content: Rasmus Højlund looks set to leave Man United, with Inter Milan keen to bring the striker back to Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "When We Were At PM Modi's Residence...": Usha Vance Recalls India Visit
content: US Second Lady Usha Vance has recalled her visit to India and her children's experience in India and called the meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi "very special."

title: "Expect US-India Trade Deal In Not Too Distant Future": Top Trump Aide
content: The trade deal between New Delhi and Washington could be finalised soon, according to US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. This comes ahead of the final round of India-US face-to-face negotiations, which are expected to take place in New Delhi this

title: "There Has To Be Tesla Manufacturing In India": Elon Musk's Father
content: Errol Musk, who is currently visiting India, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi has to look at the interests of India when it comes to bringing Tesla to the country.

title: Colorado Suspect Planned Attack For A Year, Learnt To Make Fire Bombs On YouTube
content: Mohamed Sabry Soliman, 45, was born in Egypt, lived in Kuwait for 17 years and moved three years ago to Colorado Springs, where he lived with his wife and five children.

title: Portal To Register Waqf Properties Soon, Will Aim At Transparency: Sources
content: The verdict on challenges to the amended Waqf law put on hold by the Supreme Court, the government has decided to move forward with the registration of Waqf properties.

title: Mongolia PM Resigns After Losing Confidence Vote
content: Mongolian Prime Minister Luvsannamsrain Oyun-Erdene resigned on Tuesday, a parliamentary statement said, after losing a confidence vote among lawmakers.

title: "Very Personal" For Me: Usha Vance On India-US Ties
content: US Second Lady Usha Vance termed the India-US relationship as one that is "very personal" for her, underlining that this is a time of "great opportunity" for ties between the two nations whose relationship has "ebbed and flowed at times".

title: Panama Removes Over 650 Ships From Registry Amid Sanctions, Stricter Rules
content: Panama's Maritime Authority has removed from its registry more than 650 vessels since 2019 as part of an effort to fulfill U.S. sanctions and enforce stricter rules for the ships it flags, it said on Monday.

title: Dutch Far-Right Leader Threatens To Quit Ruling Coalition Over Migration Plan
content: Dutch far-right leader Geert Wilders threatened on Monday to topple the Netherlands' already fragile right-wing government, which he said did not back his ideas for stricter asylum policies.

title: Cop Steals Rs 50 Lakh, Gold From Delhi Police's Warehouse, Arrested
content: Exposing the criminal mentality of some men in Khaki, the Delhi Police arrested one of its own personnel for stealing Rs 50 lakh and valuables from the anti-terror unit's warehouse in South Delhi, an official said on Monday.

title: Active Covid-19 Cases Cross 300-Mark In Karnataka, Authorities On Alert
content: Karnataka's Health and Family Welfare Department has said in an official statement that the number of active Covid-19 cases crossed the 300-mark in the state.

title: Bengal Woman Run Over By Bus While Trying To Get Down From It: Cops
content: A 45-year-old woman died after being run over by a bus while trying to get down from the vehicle in Kolkata's Behala area on Monday, police said.

title: Polish PM To Call For Vote Of Confidence In Government
content: Poland's Prime Minister Donald Tusk will call for a parliamentary vote of confidence in his coalition government, after his candidate, Rafal Trzaskowski, lost the presidential election on Sunday.

title: Elon Musk's Neuralink Raises $650 Million In Latest Funding Round
content: Elon Musk's brain implant company Neuralink said on Monday that it had raised $650 million in its latest funding round.

title: Trump, Xi Jinping Likely To Speak This Week Amid Tariff Tensions
content: President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping will likely speak this week, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said on Monday, days after Trump accused China of violating an agreement to roll back tariffs and trade restrictions.

title: Opinion: Elon Musk's Chatbot Can Be 'Non-Woke' Or Truthful, Not Both
content: Much like removing books on racism from a school library, "correcting" Grok's output requires an ugly intervention.

title: Why Rahul Gandhi Has His Task Cut Out For A Day's Visit To Haryana
content: Congress's Rahul Gandhi is expected to visit Chandigarh on June 4, with a list of tasks that is topped by the selection of a Leader of the Opposition.

title: "Brainwashed": Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Ex-Aide On Sending Loving Texts Years After Rape
content: A former personal assistant to Sean "Diddy" Combs who says he raped her testified that she continued sending him loving text messages for years after her job ended in 2017 because she was "brainwashed."

title: New Electric Car Scheme Offers Import Tax Cuts To Makers For Local Production
content: The government will significantly lower import tax for foreign automakers that pledge to invest in domestic electric vehicle (EV) production, as it looks to strengthen local manufacturing and draw in global industry leaders.

title: Can Courts Interfere In Disputes Over Properties Of Ex Princely States? Top Court To Examine
content: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to examine whether Article 363 of the Constitution bars courts from hearing disputes relating to properties of erstwhile princely states mentioned under the pre-constitutional covenants.
